source: 211 NH, NH Department of Military Affairs and Veterans Services, Harbor Care, Veterans Law Project

resources.name: 211 NH
resources.description: 24-hour resource line connecting veterans to food, healthcare, housing, employment, veteran services, and emergency assistance

resources.name: NH Department of Military Affairs and Veterans Services
resources.description: State agency providing advocacy, benefits assistance, and veteran support services

resources.name: Veterans Law Project (Veterans Foundation of NH)
resources.description: Provides free legal services and representation to New Hampshire veterans

resources.name: Veterans Legal Justice (VLJ)
resources.description: Provides free legal assistance for US veterans and members of service in New Hampshire

resources.name: Harbor Care - Veteran Services
resources.description: Provides SSVF case management, housing counseling, and referrals for health, legal, and financial services to veterans

resources.name: Boulder Point Veteran Housing
resources.description: Provides 25 one-bedroom apartments for veterans experiencing homelessness through HUD-VASH partnership

resources.name: Liberty House Veterans Transitional Living
resources.description: Provides transitional housing for 90 days to 1 year following a Recovery, Health and Wellness, Employment, and Housing model

resources.name: Veterans Count (Easterseals NH)
resources.description: Program providing clinical and social services, financial assistance, and help accessing housing and counseling

resources.name: SSG Fox Emotional Wellness Program
resources.description: VA-funded statewide peer support program for emotional wellness and suicide prevention for veterans

resources.name: Veterans Affairs Emergency Housing Hotline
resources.description: 24/7 emergency housing assistance for homeless veterans

resources.name: NH Legal Assistance / Civil Legal Aid
resources.description: Provides civil legal aid including veteran-specific services
